docs.snippet: The Giants signed Jerry, an offensive lineman, last week after four years with the Dolphins, and Coach Tom Coughlin said a suspension was not “in the air” at the owners’ meetings....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants signed Jerry, an offensive lineman, last week after four years with the Dolphins, and Coach Tom Coughlin said a suspension was not “in the air” at the owners’ meetings.
docs.abstract: New York Giants Coach Tom Coughlin says that team's offensive lineman John Jerry, one of the players named in report commissioned by NFL to explore accusations of widespread bullying on Miami Dolphins, is unlikely to be suspended; other football news noted.

headline.main: New Giant John Jerry Unlikely to Be Barred for Bullying, Coughlin Says
headline.print_headline: Giant Unlikely to Be Barred for Bullying, Coughlin Says

docs.snippet: Doctors treating the Hall of Fame quarterback Jim Kelly now say surgery is not the best option for dealing with his cancer....
docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors treating the Hall of Fame quarterback Jim Kelly now say surgery is not the best option for dealing with his cancer.

headline.main: Cancer Surgery Ruled Out for Jim Kelly

docs.snippet: The decision that football players at Northwestern have the right to form a union has pulled back the veil of big-time college athletics....
docs.lead_paragraph: The decision that football players at Northwestern have the right to form a union has pulled back the veil of big-time college athletics.

headline.main: A Victory for Athletes as University Employees
headline.print_headline: A Victory for Athletes as University Employees

docs.snippet: Northwestern football players are university employees and entitled to a union election, a regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Northwestern football players are university employees and entitled to a union election, a regional director of the National Labor Relations Board ruled Wednesday.
docs.abstract: Peter Ohr, regional director of the National Labor Relations Board, rules that group of football players at Northwestern are employees of the university and have the right to form a union and bargain collectively; ruling could give momentum to push for college athletes to be compensated at a time when the NCAA and its largest conferences are generating billions of dollars, primarily from football and men’s basketball.

headline.main: College Players Granted Right to Form Union
headline.print_headline: College Players Granted Right to Form Union

byline.original: By BEN STRAUSS and STEVE EDER

docs.lead_paragraph: Today on the Minute, an analysis of the Abu Ghaith case, a major ruling for college football and rap lyrics used in court.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Premier League is booming, player car parks overflow with Ferraris and Bentleys and season ticket prices at top clubs have reached eye-watering levels, but grassroots football is withering, according to Sport England.

docs.snippet: They're battling in courtrooms, and could one day meet over a bargaining table. About the only things the two sides in the debate over big-time college athletics agree on is that things are changing....

headline.print_headline: Union Ruling Comes at Bad Time for NCAA

docs.snippet: "It's like preparing so long for a big game and then when you win — it is pure joy." — Former UCLA linebacker Ramogi Huma after a federal agency ruled that football players at Northwestern University can create the nation's first union...
docs.lead_paragraph: "It's like preparing so long for a big game and then when you win — it is pure joy." — Former UCLA linebacker Ramogi Huma after a federal agency ruled that football players at Northwestern University can create the nation's first union of college athletes.
